definition[0]: if two things relate, they are connected in some way
example[0]: I don’t understand how the two ideas relate.
example[1]: The charges of fraud relate to events that took place over ten years ago.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people often say something has (something) to do with another thing, rather than relates to it:
example[2]: The changes have to do with  events that took place over ten years ago.
example[3]: I don't understand what the two ideas have to do with each other.
definition[1]: if you relate two different things, you show how they are connected
example[4]: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.
definition[2]: to tell someone about events that have happened to you or to someone else
example[5]: He later related the whole story to me.
definition[3]: to feel that you understand someone’s problem, situation etc
example[6]: Laurie finds it difficult to relate to children.
example[7]: I know he feels upset, and I can relate to that.
definition[4]: a British organization which helps those who have problems with relationships, especially marriage. It used to be called the Marriage Guidance Council.
